I have watched this film twice. The first time I wasn't able to jump into it and really give it an objective view but watching it a second time, I come to the same conclusion. I know that its an independent film and the budget was sub-par at best but it still could have brought a greater depth to it. Reading the synopsis for the film, I was thinking that things would unfold like a Lifetime movie and we wouldn't know he had another wife until halfway in and from there it would be a deeper plot unfolding of trying to confront him about his wife or plotting against him in general.

Yet, not even 10 minutes into the film and we have found out he's already married and she is feeling like a fool. After that, the plot just goes in a crazy direction with her hearing the thoughts of men and it never being explained how it happened. They gave more depth into this with the film What Women Want with Mel Gibson hearing women's thoughts after a freak accident. That was more believable than this film's star simply going to sleep after doing research and all of a sudden hearing men's thoughts.

It just doesn't make much sense. If the cast wasn't attractive, I would have stopped watching it and not giving it a shot. The music was poorly selected. The opening credits made no sense. The only scene that made me laugh out loud was when Kayla is speaking with Sean and Sean has a passenger in his taxi and he and the passenger begin yelling back and forth. That made me laugh. The rest of the movie left me wondering how Kayla is able to just travel without a moment's notice as a teacher and why the one girlfriend comes across like a 3rd wheel throughout the film. All the way around, the movie could have done better and allowed the actors/actresses to really act versus the foolishness that I watched. Like, her level of crazy with the kids was ridiculous. I have worked in the public school sector and no way she would have been able to act like she did with the boys. I was really confused when she went on that field trip with no other adults and leaving the kids unattended. It was just all non-plausible.

OK so this movie was so bad its kinda good. There are a lot of things that can be attributed to bad acting. Like when the lead was writing with her left hand and it was obvious she wasn't even making anything close to letters let alone words, or how in the only sex scene the people having sex were fully clothed, zippers closed but moaning like they were still doing it, the lady also keeps moaning after the guy gets off her... but it's not like they took an amazing script and ruined it even the story left a lot lacking. But when you put all that mess in a pot what you get is a movie you want to watch again with someone who can point out all the terrible stuff to you so you can laugh. By the way it seems like the acting got better near the end, not sure why but maybe they should have gone back and redone the first hour idk...

A very smooth love story that jabs you with comedic dialogue the keeps the movie moving at times when you you expect it to fall off some. The characters interacted and communicated like real people who weren't overacting or playing someone else. I laughed a lot more than I ever expected. This is definitely a good film for friends to watch together or with that special someone - and no I don't write for Hallmark! There are some cheesy moments that appear to head down that slippery path to "corniness" but you end up chuckling instead of frowning simply because they were able to pull off the moment without losing you.

This movie was a wonderful portrayal of life from the perspective of a young teacher, whose love in life is taken away quite suddenly. What was at stake and how she manages the stress of working, playing, finding relationship and staying focused was a true challenge. Kayla brings to light a character of such richness and wisdom. She has the courage to keep moving in space, protected by what new awareness arise, and while in the process she receives many gifts and gives gifts as well. How do you bridge your work life with the values you are trying to teach to students? I loved the themes that threaded this whole piece together. Her students...their own struggles and triumphs carried so much about community and growth. I loved that she found a way to work through the trauma and the gift she was given to help herself and her students. I loved this movie, the characters and how the story was played out. It was rich, interesting and fulfilling. Just when you thought you knew what was going to happen next, a new twist took you someplace unexpected. Kareem Molake's story is a love story and a very human story, romantic, compassionate and uplifting. And just plain hilarious at times, with a few sad moments too! The only issue I have: Where is the soundtrack? I would love to have the music. He's on My Mind

It doesn't explain how that happened for her to hear men's thoughts other than she woke up in the library and read a bunch of books. It was predictable in that you knew how the movie ended.
